snippet: Mr. Trump’s commanding victory over Senator Ted Cruz clears his path to reach the required number of delegates on the last day of primary voting on June 7.
abstract: Donald J Trump scores landslide win in Indiana Republican primary, all but ensuring delegate support needed to clinch nomination and driving rival Sen Ted Cruz to quit race; Ohio Gov John Kasich remains in contest but poses only feeble challenge; Sen Bernie Sanders rebounds to wrest Democratic victory from Hillary Clinton, though win is not expected to significantly alter Clinton's lead.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and PATRICK HEALY

lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump’s commanding victory over Senator Ted Cruz clears his path to reach the required number of delegates on the last day of primary voting on June 7.

headline.main: Donald Trump All but Clinches G.O.P. Race With Indiana Win; Ted Cruz Quits
headline.print_headline: Donald Trump All but Clinches Nomination With Indiana Win; Cruz Quits
